sen.j: 安富 元家（やすとみ もといえ）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Motoie YASUTOMI was samurai who lived in the Sengoku period (period of warring states) (Japan).
Motoie YASUTOMI was a samurai who lived in the Sengoku (Warring States) period of Japan.

sen.j: 細川氏の家宰。

sen.j: 細川京兆家の重臣として讃岐国東方守護代を世襲していた安富氏の惣領である。
sen.e: He was soryo (heir) of the Yasutomi clan who succeeded Shugodai (deputy of Shugo, provincial constable) of the east Sanuki Province as a senior vassal served the Hosokawa-keicho family.

sen.j: 元家は文明 (日本)2年（1470年）ごろから安富氏の惣領として讃岐東方守護代を務めていたことが諸史料からわかる。
sen.e: Historical materials show that Motoie served as shugodai of the east Sanuki Province as soryo of the Yasutomi clan from around 1470.

sen.j: 細川政元の家宰として京都で政元に近侍しながら、畿内各地を転戦して数々の武功を挙げた。
sen.e: While serving Masamoto HOSOKAWA as a main retainer in Kyoto, he participated in various battles in Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) to distinguish himself in various battles.

sen.j: 延徳3年（1491年）に政元が近江国守護に任じられると、その守護代に任じられ、近江に赴いて実際の政務を担当した。
sen.e: When Masamoto was appointed as Omi-no-kuni shugo (Military Commissioner of Omi-no-kuni) in 1491, Motoie was appointed as shugodai and stayed in Omi to actually attend to government affairs.
When Masamoto was appointed as Omi-no-kuni shugo (the military commissioner of Omi-no-kuni) in 1491, Motoie was appointed as the Shugodai and stayed in Omi to attend to government affairs.
When Masamoto was appointed as the military commissioner of Omi Province in 1491, Motoie was appointed as the deputy of provincial constable and stayed in Omi to attend to government affairs.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 明応2年（1493年）、明応の政変が起こると、政元の命令により上原元秀と共に正覚寺城において畠山政長を攻め滅ぼしている。
sen.e: When Coup of Meio occurred in 1493, he attacked and defeated Masanaga HATAKEYAMA in Shogaku-ji Castle with Motohide UEHARA upon the order of Masamoto.
When the Coup of Meio occurred in 1493, he attacked and defeated Masanaga HATAKEYAMA at Shogaku-ji Castle along with Motohide UEHARA, doing so upon the order of Masamoto.

sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 当時、細川政元は修験道に凝って政務を顧みることが少なくなったため、細川京兆家は「内衆」と呼ばれる重臣の合議によって幕政を運営していた。
sen.e: At that time, Masamoto HOSOKAWA had little interest in attending to government affairs, being deep into Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts); so the Hosokawa-keicho family administered the shogunate government by senior vassals taking counsel together called "uchishu."

sen.j: 元家はこの内衆筆頭として政元の政務を代行し、実際の幕政を担当した。
sen.e: Motoie acted for Masamoto to attend to the government affairs as the head of the uchishu and actually became in charge of administering the shogunate government.

sen.j: 政元の後継者問題では細川澄元を支持している。
sen.e: He supported Sumimoto HOSOKAWA as a successor of Masamoto.
He supported Sumimoto HOSOKAWA as a successor to Masamoto.

sen.j: 後法興院記によれば、元家は永正元年（1504年）、摂津国淀において寺町又三郎と合戦に及び戦死したと伝えられる。
sen.e: According to Gohokoinki Diary, Motoie died in the battle against Matasaburo TERAMACHI in Yodo, Settsu Province in 1504.
According to the Gohokoinki Diary, Motoie died in the battle against Matasaburo TERAMACHI in Yodo, Settsu Province, in 1504.

sen.j: また、永正4年（1507年）8月1日には元家の嫡男で讃岐守護代を継承していた安富元治も細川氏の内紛で戦死した（宣胤卿記）。
sen.e: On August 1, 1507, Motoharu YASUTOMI, the eldest son of Motoie who succeeded Shugodai of Sanuki Province, also died in the battle caused by the internal conflict of the Hosokawa clan (Nobutane-kyo-ki (the diary of Nobutane NAKANOMIKADO).

On August 1, 1507, Motoharu YASUTOMI, the eldest son of Motoie and successor as the Shugodai of Sanuki Province, also died in the battle caused by a conflict within the Hosokawa clan (Nobutane-kyo-ki (the diary of Nobutane NAKANOMIKADO).

On September 17, 1507, Motoharu YASUTOMI, the eldest son of Motoie and successor as the deputy of provincial constable, also died in the battle caused by a conflict within the Hosokawa clan (according to Nobutane-kyo-ki (the diary of Nobutane NAKANOMIKADO)).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: さらに永正8年（1511年）には船岡山の戦いで元治亡き後の安富氏を束ねていた安富元顕も戦死してしまう。
sen.e: Furthermore, Motoaki YASUTOMI, who succeeded Motoharu after his death as the head of the Yasutomi clan, also died in the Battle of Funaokayama in 1511.

sen.j: 元家に続き、彼の後継者として期待されていた元治・元顕兄弟の相次ぐ戦死により、安富宗家は畿内での影響力を失い、一気に没落する結果となった。
sen.e: In addition to the Motoie's death, a succession of the deaths of Motoharu and Motoaki (siblings) in battles, who were expected to be the heir to Motoie, led to the loss of power of the head of the Yasutomi family in the Kinai region, consequently to a sudden collapse of the Yasutomi family.

In addition to Motoie's death, the successive battle-related deaths of the siblings Motoharu and Motoaki, who had been expected to be heirs to Motoie, led to the loss of power of the head of the Yasutomi family in the Kinai region, and consequently to the sudden collapse of the Yasutomi family.

In addition to Motoie's death, the successive deaths in the battlefield of the siblings Motoharu and Motoaki, who had been expected to be heirs to Motoie, led to the loss of power in the Kinai region and consequently to the sudden collapse of Motoie YASUTOMI.

sen.j: 修験道に凝って政務を顧みなかった細川政元に代わって、実際に政務を代行することが多かった。
sen.e: On behalf of Masamoto HOSOKAWA who was deep into Shugendo and had little interest in attending to government affairs, Motoie actually acted in the government affairs.
On behalf of Masamoto HOSOKAWA, who was deeply involved in Shugendo and had little interest in government affairs, Motoie handled such government affairs.

sen.j: このため、実質的な権力は元家が握り、権勢を極めたといわれる。
sen.e: Therefore, it is said that in reality Motoie came into power and wielded influence.

sen.j: 政元が修験道の修行と称して丹波国に下向して京都に戻ってこようとしなかったため、庄元資と共に丹波に赴き、無理矢理政元を京都に連れ帰ったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that, when Masamoto went down to Tanba Province and would not return to Kyoto by claiming that he was conducting the training of Shugendo, Motoie visited Tanba with Motosuke SHO and forced Masamoto to come back to Kyoto.

It is said that, when Masamoto went down to Tanba Province and would not return to Kyoto, claiming that he was conducting the training of Shugendo, Motoie visited Tanba together with Motosuke SHO and forced Masamoto to return to Kyoto.

sen.j: 元家の近江守護代就任は足利義稙の六角高頼征伐に関連するものであった。
sen.e: Motoie was appointed as Omi no kuni shugodai (provincial governor of Omi Province) for the purpose of defeating Yoshitane ASHIKAGA and Takayori ROKKAKU.

sen.j: そのため、元家の近江支配は六角党のゲリラ戦などで困難を極めたといわれる。
sen.e: Accordingly, it was extremely difficult for Motoie to control Omi because of the guerrilla warfare by the Rokkaku party.

sen.j: 織田敏定や浦上則宗らとも協力して国内を転戦し近江支配に尽力したが、結局、延徳4年（1492年）9月には守護代辞任を申し出て帰京している。
sen.e: Motoie participated in various battles in the country, exerting himself to control Omi with cooperation from Toshisada ODA and Norimune URAGAMI; however, he resigned himself from Shugodai after all in September 1492 and returned to Kyoto.

Motoie participated in various battles in the country, exerting himself in order to control Omi with cooperation from Toshisada ODA and Norimune URAGAMI; however, he eventually resigned from the Shugodai in September 1492 and returned to Kyoto.

sen.j: 文亀2年（1502年）細川政元は足利義高と不仲になり安富元家邸に閉居している。
sen.e: In 1502, Masamoto HOSOKAWA fell out with Yoshitaka ASHIKAGA and thus stayed in the Motoie YASUTOMI's house.

sen.j: このことからも政元の元家への絶対的な信頼が伺える。
